data.title: James Comer: Hillary Clinton Responds to House Oversight Committee
data.description: U.S. House Oversight Committee Chairman James Comer announced that Hillary Clinton has responded to their inquiries. According to Jin10, Comer stated that efforts will be made to release the video and records of Clinton's responses as soon as possible. This development comes amid ongoing investigations and scrutiny by the committee.

data.title: Baker Hughes Rig Count Scheduled for Tomorrow Afternoon
data.description: The Baker Hughes Rig Count is set to be released tomorrow at 1:00 PM. Bespoke Investment Group posted on X, highlighting the light event calendar for the day. The Rig Count is a key indicator in the oil and gas industry, providing insights into the number of active drilling rigs. This data is closely watched by industry analysts and investors for trends in energy production and exploration activities. The release of the Rig Count can influence market dynamics and investment decisions in the energy sector.

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | Maduro Seeks Dismissal of U.S. Criminal Charges Over Due Process Concerns
data.description: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro is reportedly planning to file a motion to dismiss U.S. criminal charges against him, citing violations of due process during his arrest. According to Jin10, the motion argues that the procedures followed in apprehending Maduro were not in accordance with legal standards, potentially undermining the legitimacy of the charges. This development comes amid ongoing geopolitical tensions between Venezuela and the United States, with Maduro's administration frequently challenging U.S. actions and policies. The motion, if successful, could have significant implications for diplomatic relations and the legal proceedings against Maduro.

data.title: CoreWeave Faces Larger Losses Amid Infrastructure Spending Concerns
data.description: CoreWeave, a company specializing in AI data centers, has reported a loss greater than expected, raising concerns about its spending on infrastructure. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the financial challenges faced by the company as it invests heavily in expanding its data center capabilities. The unexpected financial results have prompted analysts to question the sustainability of CoreWeave's current investment strategy. The company's focus on infrastructure development has been a key part of its growth plan, but the recent losses suggest that this approach may need reevaluation. As CoreWeave continues to navigate the complexities of the AI data center market, stakeholders are closely monitoring its financial performance and strategic decisions.

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | Poilievre Discusses US-Canada Trade Relations
data.description: Pierre Poilievre delivered a comprehensive speech on Thursday, focusing on the dynamics of US-Canada relations and addressing trade tensions between the two nations. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting Poilievre's detailed approach to navigating these economic challenges. His address emphasized the importance of strategic policies to manage and improve trade interactions with the United States, aiming to foster a more stable and beneficial relationship. Poilievre's insights come at a time when trade relations are crucial for both countries, underscoring the need for thoughtful and effective policy measures.

data.title: US media: The Trump administration is stepping up its strategy to retain tariff revenues.
data.description: According to Politico, officials from multiple departments of the Trump administration are working on legal strategies to retain billions of dollars in tariff revenue after the Supreme Court ruled that the tariffs were "illegally collected." Several people familiar with the internal discussions said that initial plans include using policy measures to discourage companies from applying for refunds, preventing the government from actually paying refunds, or otherwise retaining at least some of the tariff revenue. One proposal is to claim that tariffs collected over the past year are legitimate revenue under a new tariff framework that the government is preparing to implement under different legal jurisdictions. Another option would allow companies to receive priority processing in the expectedly long refund queue, provided they agree to waive a portion of their refunds from the government.

data.title: OpenAI to Collaborate with Canadian Authorities for Enhanced Law Enforcement Standards
data.description: OpenAI has announced plans to establish a direct communication channel with Canadian law enforcement agencies. According to Jin10, the company is committed to working closely with the Canadian government and experts to further strengthen its law enforcement referral standards. This initiative aims to enhance cooperation and ensure effective enforcement measures in the region. OpenAI's collaboration reflects its ongoing efforts to align with regulatory frameworks and support public safety initiatives.

data.title: The probability of the Federal Reserve keeping interest rates unchanged in March is 96%.
data.description: According to CME's "FedWatch": the probability of the Federal Reserve cutting interest rates by 25 basis points by March is 4%, and the probability of keeping rates unchanged is 96.0%. The probability of the Fed cutting rates by a cumulative 25 basis points by April is 17.3%, the probability of keeping rates unchanged is 82.1%, and the probability of a cumulative 50 basis point cut is 0.6%. The probability of a cumulative 25 basis point cut by June is 43%.

data.title: Marathon Digital Holdings Expands into AI Data Centers with Starwood Partnership
data.description: Marathon Digital Holdings, a prominent Bitcoin mining company, has announced a partnership with investment firm Starwood to repurpose and expand certain facilities for AI data center usage. According to NS3.AI, this strategic move marks Marathon's diversification into AI infrastructure, complementing its primary focus on cryptocurrency mining. Following the announcement, Marathon's stock price surged by 17%, indicating positive investor sentiment towards the company's expansion efforts.

data.title: Kratos Aims to Raise $1 Billion Amid Increased Defense Spending
data.description: Kratos Defense & Security Solutions is planning to raise $1 billion through a share sale. Bloomberg posted on X that this move comes as government expenditure on defense is on the rise. The company aims to capitalize on the increased demand for defense solutions, driven by heightened global security concerns. Kratos, known for its advanced technology and defense capabilities, is positioning itself to meet the growing needs of the defense sector. The funds raised will likely support the company's expansion and development of new technologies to enhance its offerings in the defense market.

data.title: Reid Hoffman's Ethereum Holdings Revealed
data.description: Reid Hoffman, co-founder of LinkedIn, has been identified as owning Ethereum valued at approximately $6.1 million. According to NS3.AI, this information was disclosed through data reported by Arkham and shared by U.Today. Hoffman's substantial investment in Ethereum underscores a significant endorsement of the cryptocurrency by a leading figure in the tech industry.

data.title: Finland Investigates Property Purchases Near Sensitive Sites
data.description: The Finnish government is conducting an investigation into numerous properties acquired near critical infrastructure and sensitive locations. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting concerns about potential Russian infiltration. Authorities are scrutinizing these transactions to determine if they pose any security risks. The investigation reflects growing apprehensions about foreign influence and the safeguarding of national security. The Finnish government aims to ensure that strategic sites remain protected from any external threats.

data.title: India Urged to Capitalize on Silicon Valley's Data Boom
data.description: India is being encouraged to take advantage of the burgeoning data opportunities presented by Silicon Valley's tech industry. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the potential benefits for India in harnessing this digital transformation. As global tech companies continue to expand their data-driven operations, India has the chance to position itself as a key player in this sector. By leveraging its technological capabilities and vast talent pool, India could significantly enhance its economic growth and innovation landscape. The focus is on creating a robust framework that supports data utilization while ensuring privacy and security. This strategic move could propel India into a leading role in the global digital economy, fostering new partnerships and driving technological advancements.

data.title: Grayscale's Latest Crypto Holdings Update
data.description:
Grayscale has released its latest update on cryptocurrency holdings, detailing the assets under management across various digital currencies. Grayscale posted on X, highlighting the inclusion of major cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), Solana (SOL), and XRP among others.

The update includes a comprehensive list of assets, featuring Binance Coin (BNB), Litecoin (LTC), Zcash (ZEC), Chainlink (LINK), and Sui (SUI). Other notable mentions are Stellar (XLM), Internet Protocol (IP), Tao (TAO), Dogecoin (DOGE), Avalanche (AVAX), Zen (ZEN), SXT, WAL, DEEP, PYTH, Filecoin (FIL), Livepeer (LPT), Aave (AAVE), Near Protocol (NEAR), Stacks (STX), Decentraland (MANA), Bitcoin Cash (BCH), Ethereum Classic (ETC), Basic Attention Token (BAT), and Stellar (XLM).

Grayscale's update reflects the company's ongoing commitment to providing investors with diversified exposure to the cryptocurrency market. The detailed list of holdings underscores the breadth of Grayscale's investment strategy, catering to a wide range of digital assets.

This announcement comes amid a period of heightened interest in digital currencies, as investors continue to seek opportunities in the evolving crypto landscape. Grayscale's transparency in reporting its holdings is seen as a positive move for the industry, offering insights into the company's asset management approach.

data.title: Duolingo's Subscriber Growth Strategy Impacts Earnings
data.description: Duolingo shares experienced a significant drop of up to 22% in post-market trading following the company's announcement regarding its strategy to increase subscribers. Bloomberg posted on X that this approach is expected to result in slower earnings growth and reduced profit margins in the near term. The language-learning platform's focus on expanding its user base is seen as a move that could impact its financial performance temporarily.

data.title: Coupang Faces Unexpected Loss Amid Data Breach Challenges
data.description: Coupang has announced an unforeseen loss for the fourth quarter, highlighting the difficulties the company is experiencing after a significant data breach in South Korea, its primary market. Bloomberg posted on X, detailing the financial strain on the e-commerce giant as it navigates the repercussions of the security incident. The breach has raised concerns about customer trust and data security, impacting Coupang's operations and financial performance. The company is working to address these issues while maintaining its market position in South Korea.

data.title: Flutter's Fourth-Quarter Results Miss Wall Street Estimates
data.description: Flutter, the parent company of the FanDuel gambling platform in the United States, announced its fourth-quarter financial results, which did not meet Wall Street expectations. Bloomberg posted on X that the company's performance was impacted by a slowdown in new customer registrations and a moderation in wagering growth. Despite these challenges, Flutter continues to navigate the competitive landscape of the gambling industry, seeking strategies to enhance its market position and drive future growth.

data.title: Nasdaq Files for VanEck's JitoSOL ETF Listing with SEC
data.description: Nasdaq has submitted a filing to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to list VanEck's JitoSOL ETF, which features a liquid staking token based on Solana. According to NS3.AI, if the proposal is approved, the staking rewards will be integrated directly into the fund's Net Asset Value (NAV) instead of being distributed separately to investors. This initiative represents a novel method of handling staking rewards within an ETF framework.

data.title: STOCKS | European Stock Indices Rise for Second Consecutive Day
data.description: European stock indices have experienced gains for the second day in a row. According to RTHK, the UK's FTSE 100 Index closed at 10,846 points, marking an increase of 40 points or 0.37%. Meanwhile, France's CAC Index ended at 8,620 points, up by 61 points or 0.72%. Germany's DAX Index also saw an increase, closing at 25,289 points, which is a rise of 113 points or 0.45%.
